Public Sub New (action As PackagingAction, numberCompleted As Integer)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: The action that the packaging process is currently performing.
The number of simultaneous times that the specified occurred.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In certain situations and for specific types, multiple packaging progress events occur at the same time. These logically distinct, but temporally identical, events are combined into a single <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.XpsPackagingPolicy.PackagingProgressEvent> and `numberCompleted` is more than 1. For example, when you print, font subsetting is performed every four pages. Each page must be cached until the subsetting is complete, and then all four <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.PackagingAction.FixedPageCompleted> events occur at the same time. The constructor for the resulting <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.PackagingProgressEventArgs> sets `action` to <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.PackagingAction.FixedPageCompleted> and sets `numberCompleted` to 4.
For example, if a package consists of a single four-page document that uses one font and no images or other resources, the sequence of events might occur as shown in the following table.
**The sequence of events for a simple package**
AddingDocumentSequence 1
AddingFixedDocument 1
AddingFixedPage 1
AddingFixedPage 1
AddingFixedPage 1
AddingFixedPage 1
FontAdded 1
FixedPageCompleted 4
FixedDocumentCompleted 1
DocumentSequenceCompleted 1
XpsDocumentCommitted 1

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Action As PackagingAction

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates what action is currently occurring in the packaging process.
Docs.value: A that represents the part of the packaging process that is currently occurring.

Docs.summary: Gets the number of simultaneous times that the action that is identified in has occurred.
Docs.value: An that represents the number of simultaneous times that the action that is identified in has occurred.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In certain situations and for specific types, multiple packaging progress events occur at the same time. These logically distinct, but temporally identical, events are combined into a single <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.XpsPackagingPolicy.PackagingProgressEvent> and <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.PackagingProgressEventArgs.NumberCompleted%2A> is more than 1. For example, when you print, font subsetting is performed every four pages. Each page must be cached until the subsetting is complete, and then all four <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.PackagingAction.FixedPageCompleted> events occur at the same time. The resulting <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.PackagingProgressEventArgs> sets <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.PackagingProgressEventArgs.Action%2A> to <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.PackagingAction.FixedPageCompleted> and sets <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.PackagingProgressEventArgs.NumberCompleted%2A> to 4.
For example, if a package consists of a single four-page document that uses one font and no images or other resources, the sequence of events might occur as shown in the following table:
**The sequence of events for a simple package**
AddingDocumentSequence 1
AddingFixedDocument 1
AddingFixedPage 1
AddingFixedPage 1
AddingFixedPage 1
AddingFixedPage 1
FontAdded 1
FixedPageCompleted 4
FixedDocumentCompleted 1
DocumentSequenceCompleted 1
XpsDocumentCommitted 1
